intro: Bellevalia sitiaca, commonly known as the Sitia bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Bellevalia sitiaca is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
